channel.title: Comments on: Grocery Shopping With A Scan Gun At Giant

item.title: By: Joanne Hemingway
item.dc:creator: Joanne Hemingway
item.description: How come this resource of shopping is not in California?!! It has been over a year since these comments were given - has there been anymore stores that have these?
item.content:encoded: How come this resource of shopping is not in California?!! It has been over a year since these comments were given – has there been anymore stores that have these?

item.title: By: 2009.18 | Startpages | SelfScan | eDeals « Retail Technology Trends
item.dc:creator: 2009.18 | Startpages | SelfScan | eDeals « Retail Technology Trends
item.description: [...] about scanning your own items as you walk around with the store. Various organizations have tried this idea and variations on it. I haven’t seen it stick anywhere as of yet. Why [...]
item.content:encoded: […] about scanning your own items as you walk around with the store. Various organizations have tried this idea and variations on it. I haven’t seen it stick anywhere as of yet. Why […]

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description:
When you check out you put the scan gun on the conveyor belt and the cashier scans a special barcode to signal your done shopping. Then all of your data in the scangun is transferred to the cash register system so you can pay and a receipt is printed.
There's nothing really stopping you from putting extra groceries in your bag and not paying for them. It's also pretty easy to futz with the scale (ex. 10 apples = 0.1 lbs, sure why not?).
I've never felt compelled to cheat my grocery store but their are certainly weaknesses in the system.
item.content:encoded:
When you check out you put the scan gun on the conveyor belt and the cashier scans a special barcode to signal your done shopping. Then all of your data in the scangun is transferred to the cash register system so you can pay and a receipt is printed.

There’s nothing really stopping you from putting extra groceries in your bag and not paying for them. It’s also pretty easy to futz with the scale (ex. 10 apples = 0.1 lbs, sure why not?).

I’ve never felt compelled to cheat my grocery store but their are certainly weaknesses in the system.

item.title: By: Ryan
item.dc:creator: Ryan
item.description: How does the check out process work? What is to stop someone from stealing items? Do they have to place there bags on a scale when they check out? Lastly, what can you go through a none self checkout line and how does that work?
item.content:encoded: How does the check out process work? What is to stop someone from stealing items? Do they have to place there bags on a scale when they check out? Lastly, what can you go through a none self checkout line and how does that work?

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: You might try Giant Store #0363 in Dundalk, MD. According to Webmommy from this forum, she said she used one and her location is in Dundalk -> http://talk.baltimoresun.com/showthread.php?p=4027426

item.title: By: DiamondEye

item.description: Are there any Giant's in Baltimore city with this technology?
item.content:encoded: Are there any Giant’s in Baltimore city with this technology?

item.title: By: DiamondEye
item.dc:creator: DiamondEye
item.description: I went to three Giant Food's in Baltimore, the Rotunda, the one on York road, and the one in Towson, I couldn't find them. Where is a Gian in Baltimore with this?
item.content:encoded: I went to three Giant Food’s in Baltimore, the Rotunda, the one on York road, and the one in Towson, I couldn’t find them. Where is a Gian in Baltimore with this?

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: Yea you would definitely need a helper for this. Although another blog I read about this recommended bringing cardboard boxes with you.
item.content:encoded: Yea you would definitely need a helper for this. Although another blog I read about this recommended bringing cardboard boxes with you.
